# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width=10)
    wrapped_text = ""
    
    for word in split(text, " ")
        if length(wrapped_text) + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n" # add a new line
            wrapped_text += word # start a new line with the word
        else
            wrapped_text *= " " # if not exceeded, just add a space
            wrapped_text += word
        end
    end
    
    return wrapped_text
end

example = wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines", 12)
println(example)
```

In this example, the `wrap_string` function is called with a sample text and a maximum text width of 12 characters. The result is then printed, which demonstrates how the words are wrapped to fit within the specified width.
